head.title: Welcome to WSO2 Identity Server v5.1.0!

body.h1: WSO2 Identity Server : An Open Source Identity and Entitlement Management Server
body.h3: WSO2 Identity Server v5.1.0 Release Note
body.p: The WSO2 Identity Server team is pleased to announce the release of version 5.1.0 of the WSO2 Identity Server (IS).
WSO2 Identity Server is an open source Identity and Entitlement management server having support for XACML, SAML, OAuth, OpenID, OpenID Connect, SCIM and heterogeneous user stores.
WSO2 Identity Server is developed on top of the revolutionary WSO2 Carbon platform, an OSGi based framework that provides seamless modularity to your SOA via componentization.
All the major features have been developed as pluggable Carbon components.
You can download this distribution from http://wso2.com/products/identity-server/.

The online documentation is available at
http://docs.wso2.org/wiki/display/IS510/WSO2+Identity+Server+Documentation.

ol.li: Go to the bin directory in the extracted folder
Run the wso2server.sh or wso2server.bat as appropriate

If you need to start the OSGi console with the server use the property -DosgiConsole when starting the server. The INSTALL.txt file found on the installation directory will give you a comprehensive set of options and properties that can be passed into the startup script

ul.li: Comprehensive support for multiple user stores.
User Store Management user interface.
Per tenant/organization user stores.
OAuth 2.0 based authentication for SCIM.
OpenID Connect Basic Client Profile
SAML2 grant type for OAuth 2.0.
Trusted SAML2 Identity Provider Management user interface.
Multiple trusted Identity Providers per tenant/organization.
Ability customize login pages for SAML2, OAuth, OpenID Connect, Passive STS and OpenID outside IS.
User account locking.
User name/password validation policies.
Account recovery with email address or secret questions.
SAML2 Web SSSO HTTP POST binding (Authentication Request).
Seamless integration with Google Apps and Salesforce.
Improved XACML editor.
Ability to define grant types per OAuth 2.0 applications.

body.h2: Key Features of WSO2 Identity Server

ul.li: Entitlement Engine with XACML 3.0/2.0 and WS-XACML support.
OAuth Authorization Server with OAuth 2.0/1.0a support.
Identity Provisioning with SCIM 1.1.
SAML 2.0 Web Browser SSO Identity Provider.
OpenID 2.0 OpenID Provider.
Claim based Security Token Service(STS) with SAML 2.0/1.1 support.
Support for various types of User Stores such as JDBC, Cassandra, LDAP, Active Directory in Read/Write mode.
Integrated Windows Authentication and webSEAL authentication.
XMPP based multi-factor authentication.
Improved User Management.
Claim Management.
User Profiles and Profile Management.
XKMS.
Separable front-end and back-end - a single front-end server can be used to administer several back-end servers.
